header.title: Frequently Asked Questions
header.subtitle: Answers to common questions about WSMath coaching services.

top.heading: Questions parents and students ask most
top.subheading: Clear expectations. Clear structure. Clear results.

items.a: WSMath is for IBDP (AA/AI HL/SL), A-Level/IAL, and IGCSE students who want a structured, exam-first plan—with clear weekly actions, accountability, and measurable grade improvement.

Lessons are run live on Zoom and are highly interactive. I’ll explain the core concept, then we apply it immediately through targeted past-paper questions with markscheme-focused thinking. After each lesson, you’ll receive structured homework to consolidate the skills and eliminate recurring errors. 

Face-to-face lessons are also available at my centre in Times Square, Causeway Bay.

items.q: How many hours per week do I need for a Level 6 / 7?
items.a: As a baseline, a Level 6 typically requires around 6 hours per week in total (lessons + independent practice), while a Level 7 usually requires 7+ hours per week. The exact plan depends on your current level, how quickly you need to improve, and how consistently you can follow the weekly workload.

items.q: Do you teach in English or Chinese?
items.a: Lessons are primarily delivered in Cantonese/Mandarin to ensure genuine understanding. All exam execution is trained in English — questions, key terms, and written solutions in the markscheme style. Full English delivery is available on request.

items.q: What if my foundation is weak?
items.a: That’s very common. We start with a diagnostic to pinpoint the exact gaps, rebuild the fundamentals by topic, and only then scale into past papers and markscheme execution. You’ll follow a weekly plan designed to turn weak areas into reliable exam marks.
Usually no — my teaching is a system (diagnosis → plan → practice → feedback loops), so a single lesson doesn’t represent the real experience or results.

items.q: Group class vs 1-to-1 — what’s the difference?
items.a: Group is the most cost-effective way to follow a full structure and routine. 1-to-1 is fully personalised with faster feedback and more targeted pacing.

items.q: What do I need to prepare?
items.a: iPad + Apple Pencil + GoodNotes is ideal for fast, interactive work. A stable internet connection and willingness to practise between lessons matter most.
